cont.entity_a: Easy on the hands with a light touch and white keys visible in dark rooms. Occasionally misses letters and the space bar design is flawed. Not Apple compliant, lacking proper meta key layout. Has issues with the space bar and key layout.
cont.entity_b: Has a tight action and seems durable. Multimedia buttons are not fully customizable.

cont.entity_a: Very accurate with a useful zoom function. Touch is hard to control and the battery often shows as weak. Great, but has issues with connection problems and low battery warnings.
cont.entity_b: Feels cheaper and clunky with noticeable input lag. Big and clumpy with poor movement. Ergonomic but heavy due to batteries.

cont.entity_a: Wireless connection has decent range. Work without wires, but the space bar may not register sometimes. Have continual connection problems.
cont.entity_b: The keyboard and mouse have good range and work flawlessly.

cont.entity_a: The mouse touch is hard to control and the battery often shows as weak. Have continual low battery warnings.
cont.entity_b: The mouse battery provides a low charge warning. The wireless base acts as a charger for the mouse.
Installation is easy, almost plug and play.

cont.entity_a: Five configurable hotkeys and dedicated keys for mail and internet.
cont.entity_b: The scroll wheel occasionally fails due to driver issues.
